title: Nee Soon Constituency
text:
Nee Soon Constituency was a <a href="Single%20Member%20Constituency">single member constituency</a> in the <a href="North%20Region%2C%20Singapore">northern</a> area in Singapore that was created in <a href="Singaporean%20general%20election%2C%201959">1959 general elections</a> and ceased to exist prior to <a href="Singaporean%20general%20election%2C%201988">1988 general elections</a>.
History.
Nee Soon was one of the rural areas in the <a href="North%20Region%2C%20Singapore">north</a> of <a href="Singapore">Singapore</a>. At its inception in 1959, there were only 8,694 voters even including present-day <a href="Ang%20Mo%20Kio">Ang Mo Kio</a> town, whereas wards nearer to the <a href="City%20Business%20District">city centre</a> such as <a href="Kreta%20Ayer">Kreta Ayer</a> had 14,173 voters in a much smaller area.
This ward was finally dissolved prior to the <a href="Singaporean%20general%20election%2C%201988">1988 general elections</a>, with most of the ward forming <a href="Nee%20Soon%20South%20SMC">Nee Soon South SMC</a> consisting of <a href="Khatib">Khatib</a> and <a href="Yio%20Chu%20Kang">Yio Chu Kang</a> (near <a href="Yio%20Chu%20Kang%20MRT%20station">Yio Chu Kang MRT station</a>), and the portion in <a href="Yishun">Yishun</a> Central being renamed <a href="Nee%20Soon%20Central%20SMC">Nee Soon Central SMC</a> where former opposition MP <a href="Cheo%20Chai%20Chen">Cheo Chai Chen</a> made his debut there. The remainder of this constituency was carved into 2 sub-divisions of <a href="Chong%20Pang">Chong Pang</a> and <a href="Nee%20Soon%20East%20SMC">Nee Soon East</a>. The latter ward was a part of <a href="Sembawang%20GRC">Sembawang GRC</a> until the <a href="Singaporean%20general%20election%2C%202001">2001 general elections</a> which saw the <a href="Workers%27%20Party%20of%20Singapore">Workers' Party</a> contest there.
